newsitem.title: GERMANY: TENNIS-STICH RECONSIDERS PLAYING FRENCH OPEN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-STICH RECONSIDERS PLAYING FRENCH OPEN.

text.p: A day after announcing he would not play in the French Open, Germany's Michael Stich said on Friday he was having second thoughts and may compete in the grand slam event.
Stich, who lost last year's Roland Garros final to Yevgeny Kafelnikov, said on Thursday that a nagging shoulder injury would stop him playing in the Open which starts next week.
But the 1991 Wimbledon champion, who has decided to retire at the end of the year, appeared in Friday's French Open draw alongside Spain's Marcos Aurelio Gorriz, ranked 102 in world.
Stich indicated he will wait until after his doubles match against Sweden in the World Team Cup on Saturday before making his final decision.
